snippet: Tehran has stopped allowing Russian planes to fly into Syria from one of its bases, complaining that the Kremlin has been too public about the deal....
abstract: Russian planes are no longer granted access to Hamadan base in Iran, from which Kremlin had launched bombing runs into Syria; Iranian officials claim Russian arrogance and public boasting over agreement led to decision to revoke access.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and ANDREW E. KRAMER
byline.contributor: Anne Barnard reported from Beirut, and Andrew E. Kramer from Moscow. Rick Gladstone contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Tehran has stopped allowing Russian planes to fly into Syria from one of its bases, complaining that the Kremlin has been too public about the deal.

headline.main: Iran Revokes Russia’s Use of Air Base, Saying Moscow ‘Betrayed Trust’
headline.print_headline: Citing Arrogance and Betrayed Trust, Iran Revokes Russia’s Use of Air Base
